comment: He did not stay on topic very well in class. We would start off talking about one thing and he'd go off on a tangent. When I tried taking later Italian classes, I could not keep up with the rest of the class because I learned so little in this class. I would not recommend him.

Dr. Muddei is a wonderful person with a very interesting past and great stories to share. Being Arabic, his English is not perfect and often times there is difficulty in communication. I would not suggest this professor if this is your first latin-based language class. Otherwise, the class is not fairly easy if you attend all the classes and study.
Worst teacher I've ever had. Great sotries, funny. Just a bad teacher.

I hate this class! I came into it really excited and I'm very disappointed. I'm good at spanish but this man just can't teach! I am struggling to get a B when I got straight A's in spanish. Do not take him if you don't have to. Doesn't explain anything just expects you to learn everything on your own.
Dr Muddei is a fascinating man with lots of interesting stories.  I highly recommend him for 1002.  He will teach you odd little phrases and send you to lots of websites to help improve your Italian.

He's a fantastic man. His knowledge of the world and his personal history is fascinating. However, his teaching ability is rather low. His English is very broken and can be incredibly difficult to understand. If Italian is not really required for your major and is just an elective, I'd recommend taking him. He's absolutely hilarious.
I love this professor. I've had his class twice so far, and am heartbroken that I can't take his class next semester.

He tells alot of stories about Italy and Somalia. Wonderful teacher, but you do have to teach yourself if you want to ace the class. He goes over what you need to learn in class and how its done, then you go home and study it and perfect it. We have Quia (sucks), but other than that the class is not that hard. A few of the concepts are though.

If lang. DO NOT come easy to you, do NOT take. He's a sweet, hilarious old man who is always cheerful, but he doesn't speak English very well, so he can't really explain things clearly. Otherwise, tests = easy (detailed study guides provided), and the only HW is Quia. I've had to teach myself pretty much, but he's really nice, so I don't mind :-p.
I really liked this class. It's definitely true that he grades easier if he likes you. You have to talk in this class, if he thinks you have no personality, you won't get good grades.

I took Dr. Muddei his first semester at KSU.  As others have said, he has interesting stories but they weren't very helpful.  Doesn't grade everyone the same.  If you understand some Italian, he expects you to be perfect.  Always hand write papers.  Takes off for typed documents or outright refuses to take them.  Poor-to-average instructor.

Barley speaks English but really funny stories to tell. Dont be afraid to speak up in class, he loves talkers! Though he doesnt have much direction in class or doesnt always understand your question, go exactly by the sheets he gives before the tests and what he says about them.  We had like 4 tests, 2 easy writing things and one EASY oral pres.

Dr. Muddei is a very intelligent man speaking far too many languages.  His mix of Somalitalenglish is...impressive but unintelligible.  Other than that, the class is easy if you're good with languages and is very interesting.  Dr. Muddei works with you if you need extensions or makeup tests.

I was so excited to take this class but it was a huge disappointment.  It was painfully slow, but then he sometimes assigned work way beyond our comphrehension level.  He occasionally criticizes/mocks students for mistakes they make.  Eventually he progressed to making fun of students outright.  The only good thing is that he's easy to sidetrack.

He didn't quite understand how the education system worked when I took him, so our tests and homework got messed up, but he was a good teacher, and I'm sure he's got the hang of it by now. He has lots of fun, interesting little stories from Italy.
I had issues understanding his english, but he told great stories and made the lessons interesting.
this is a wonderful teacher, and a precious human being.  he knows his italian very well, and brings a wealth of information and culture to his students.

the most wonderful language teacher... but for beginners, he might seem to rush thru material.  he adds such an interesting twist to his lectures thru stories of culture and his experiences... you will fall in love with this old man
